snippet: Miller Fortune, at 6.9 percent alcohol by volume, is meant to appeal to a generation that buys distilled spirits more than its older siblings.
abstract: Stuart Elliot Advertising column; MillerCoors is introducing Miller Fortune, brew with higher alcohol by volume, which is meant to appeal to consumers in their 20s who prefer to buy liquor; in effort to create a more sophisticated image for the beer, company is launching big advertising campaign using commercials that feature British actor Mark Strong.
lead_paragraph: Miller Fortune, at 6.9 percent alcohol by volume, is meant to appeal to a generation that buys distilled spirits more than its older siblings.

headline.main: To Draw Millennials, a Stronger Beer Made to Suggest Spirits
headline.print_headline: To Draw Millennials, a Stronger Beer Made to Suggest Spirits
